alert.note: Alert for Fayette; Spalding (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 07 at 12:36PM EDT until April 08 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Flint River near Griffin affecting Fayette and Spalding Counties. For the Flint River Basin...including Americus, Lovejoy, Lake Horton, Lake Kedron Tailrace, Lake Peachtree Tailrace, Woolsey, Sharpsburg, Peachtree City, Below Lake McIntosh, Senoia, Griffin, Orchard Hill, Flint River near Griffin, Thomaston, Molena, Carsonville Hwy. 19, Montezuma, Turkey Creek at Byromville... Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Flint River near Griffin. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 12 feet, Flood stage is reached. Minor flooding begins in the woodlands...fields and pasture upstream and downstream from the gage on Georgia Highway 16 or Newnan Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:45 AM EDT Thursday the stage was 12 feet and rising. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:45 AM EDT Thursday was 12 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 12.1 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight to 10.9 feet and begin rising again early Saturday morning. It will rise to 11 feet Saturday morning. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 12 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.1 feet on 04/21/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
